snippet: A blaze on Flatbush Avenue in Prospect Heights, which the Fire Department said was accidental, brought together families that had lived and worked next door to one another for two generations.
abstract: Deadly fire at Flatbush Hardware in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, unites two immigrant families who had long worked side by side in grief; fire destroys store, livelihood of the Nation family, and claims life of Bassam Awad, whose family ran deli next door and had rented storefront to the Nations since 1989; Fire Department has classified blaze as accidental.

byline.contributor: Annie Correal and Andy Newman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A blaze on Flatbush Avenue in Prospect Heights, which the Fire Department said was accidental, brought together families that had lived and worked next door to one another for two generations.

headline.main: After Fire, 2 Brooklyn Families Linked by Work Are Now Bound by Grief
headline.print_headline: After Fire, 2 Families Linked by Work Are Now Bound by Grief
